definition: to gather/to assemble
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Half an hour after they had all arrived at the southeast angle of the lake, on Prospect Heights.
sentences.chinese: 半个钟头以后，他们齐集在眺望岗上湖的东南角。

sentences.english: If you can make a clone of kijiji, it would even be better.
sentences.chinese: 如果你可以做一个客齐集克隆，它甚至会更好。

definition: to meet together/to assemble (of a group of people)
to come together/to assemble
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to congregate in one hall (idiom); to gather under one roof
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to go to a meeting
to attend a ritual
to convene/to gather
to be all present
outstanding heroes/warlords vying for supremacy (in former times)/stars (of sports or pop music)
to meet for negotiation
a magnificent and unprecedented event (idiom)
to grace sb with one's presence/your arrival (honorific)/your esteemed presence
to recruit/to gather together (volunteers)
to vow before one's troops
